content: We host a few meetups here in Boston (https://www.meetup.com/Boston-CSS/, https://www.meetup.com/Bostons-Elixir-Women/), and have space and equipment. As fellow implementors, we would like to start a Boston -area meetup for FHIR, maybe ever-other-month to start. Anyone here interested?
First meeting is TBD, but there is a placeholder now -- https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/ -- Looking to have a first meet up in April

We have an event planned for April 19. The overall topic will be FHIR and Genetics. Weâ€™ll have Gil Alterovitz (SMART/FHIR Genomics Lead) and James Lindsay (DFCI Biostats/Computational Biology) discuss some of their work in this area, and of course plenty of time for open discussion around other works in progress (genetics or otherwise!) -- https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/events/238514616/
We are having another meeting in June -- https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/events/239914691/ -- looking for speakers if you are interested!
ANN: We are having a pre-dev-days free community meetup in Boston. Information here: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/events/250842491/

ANN: We are having a pre-dev-days free community meetup in Boston. Information here: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/events/250842491/

Dear all, we want to present our Efferent Healthcare Platform during the pre-devdays meeting. It is not based on SMART. Is that OK?

More details here: http://www.efferenthealth.com/site/the-efferent-healthcare-platform/
Of course -- I for one would love to learn more about what you're building.

ANN: We are having a pre-dev-days free community meetup in Boston. Information here: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-FHIR/events/250842491/

We still have some spots left. Stop by if you in town and want something to do this evening. Also we want to make sure we buy enough beer :)
